applet_data.title: SELF-CHECK
applet_data.intro: Match each work of art with its description by dragging it into the correct box.

cols.col: Depicts a cultural icon of the U.S., representing feminism and economic power.
Conveys both optimism and imperfection, and contains symbols of soldiers at war.
Created in reaction to the discrimination exemplified in the Rodney King incident.
Portrays a fashionable and modern yet psychologically ambiguous figure.
A depiction of abstracted, dislocated human figures, potentially reflecting the struggles of segregation.
Symbolizes the community that developed at a Japanese internment camp in Arkansas.
Depicts a somber institution and potentially offers harsh commentary on the Vietnam war.
Portrays a detailed version of a Soviet Symbol, which the artist insisted was not politically motivated.
An abstract painting with bold and energetic brush strokes, created to evoke emotion.
A photorealistic painting that employs a wide-angle format and high contrast between near and far.
Represents the doom of a species and the effect of human expansion on the violent natural world.
Conveys a sense of mystery and ritual, and reflects the artist's understanding of visual rhythm.
A portrait with monochromatic color schemes created in the first decade of the 20th century.
Though primarily dark in composition, the expert use of color in this piece guides the eye of the viewer.
An impressionist piece that reflects the artists' interest in painting middle-class women.
This piece depicts a prominent local professional graced with both intellect and feeling.
From the artist's War Series of 1918, this piece depicts horrifying human suffering.
A basswood carving that symbolizes the life of African-Americans living in post Civil War America.
This piece symbolizes the rhetoric of a speech in 1896 against hard money policies of East Coast Banks.
Depicts a rich natural setting and portrays its subject as a refined, aesthetically conscious individual.
This piece emphasizes the features of the surroundings, illuminated by natural and artifical light.
A landmark piece of American impressionism that was created based on a published photograph.
Reminiscent of a tapestry, this piece expresses the sensory experience of the wilderness.
While color and setting create a sombre atmosphere, the subjects express a sense of hope.
Portrays the reaction of the Americans to mass media while highlighting the social hierarchy of the time.
A likeness of a prominent figure who was present at treaty negotiations in D.C. during the 19th century.
One painting from the only large set of early colonial portraits that exists today in its entirety.
Most individuals in this painting are tired and fearful, suffering from the impact of the Civil War.
